channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Europe’s answer to the Magnificent Seven comes up short
item.description: Europe’s answer to the Magnificent Seven is leaving much to be desired after two of the Continent’s biggest companies, ASML Holding and LVMH Moet Henn...

item.title: Stock Futures Flat Amid Morgan Stanley Earnings, Decline in Global Chip Stocks
item.description: U.S. futures were little changed while overseas markets were muted.

item.title: Dollar Strengthens As Inflation Cools In Developed Economies
item.description: The WSJ Dollar Index rose as the greenback gained against the pound and euro amid signs of cooling prices in the U.K and New Zealand.

item.title: Don’t bring back traditional private-sector pensions
item.description: They’re not good for workers and distract from the key issue: continuous coverage

item.title: Abbott Labs beats Q3 sales and earnings expectations, raises full-year outlook

item.title: Treasury yields slip on ‘path of least resistance’ as oil price falls further and U.K. inflation dives

item.title: Nvidia Will Dominate Big Tech's Earnings Season Again
item.description: Capital spending by Microsoft, Google, Amazon and Meta is expected to keep surging, while Apple’s AI debut gets clouded.

item.title: Bank of America's Wall Street Bet Pays Off
item.description: As interest income rises, BofA also stands to gain from a trading and investment-banking bump.

item.title: Luxury's Last Growth Engine Has Stalled
item.description: A sudden slowdown in Chinese demand reported by Louis Vuitton’s owner is a bad sign for the luxury industry.
